Text:
You should be able to see it from here! That's the
mansion. It's got its own private beach, even.

A beautiful home with its own beach and excellent
access to the city... How is it that such an amazing
property is still available?

I totally get what you mean, Gammy. So, allow me to
explain!
This is the Youth Manor House.

The self-governing territory of Altena, one of the
members of the City-State Alliance, built this
residence for the young people of its nation!

This means it was mainly used as nationally-run
lodging where young Altenans could stay at an
affordable rate!

A reasonably-priced manor resort... Altena was
encouraging the social experience of its next
generation, I see.

No matter the era, leisure is the bread and butter of
the trade city! But something HUGE was about to rock
the foundations of this peaceful house!

The elf-governing territory of Altena got invaded by
the Velgalta Empire!

As a small nation and member of the City States,
Altena always kept a cautious eye on what Velgalta
was up to!

But Velgalta poked away at a political divide and
eventually got the excuse it needed to attack... With
no means of resisting, Altena had no choice but to
surrender and become a vassal state! None at all!

The emperor of Velgalta sent some aristocrats from
his mother's side to rule the new territory in place
of its former lords—and thus the Altena Empire was
born as a full-fledged domain of Velgalta!

As property of the formerly self-governing territory,
the Youth Manor House should have become the property
of Velgalta as well... BUT!
Velgalta ignored this mansion and its beach!
Oh, why is that?

...It's said Velgalta invaded Altena to use as a
launch point for a future invasion of Midgar.

Though Orum would still be in between, having Altena
as a base in the City States would allow Velgalta to
attack Midgar with ease.

On the other hand, while Velgalta's actions were
overt, they had skirted away from amassing components
of what could be seen as an obvious intent to invade—

And so Velgalta has let the Youth Manor House be,
making no moves to seize it.

It's true. Officially annexing this location would be
tantamount to creating an economic bridgehead right
on Midgar's doorstep.

Furthermore, it also has a beach that can be used
freely. That means this location could be used even
as a military transport base.
Exactly. Nothing gets by you, Gammy!

So long story short, Velgalta has been kind enough to
put Youth Manor House up for sale!
...Who oversees the residence and private beach?

The real estate guild that handles public properties
in the trade city. But with the place being what it
is, it's been sitting without a buyer for quite a
while now.

Velgalta's own aristocrats and merchants are
prohibited from purchasing it, and that of course
applies to their counterparts from Oriana, too, due
to frosty relations between the two countries—

And one can't imagine any potential buyers in Midgar
wanting to spend so much for the house and beach just
to earn the kingdom's ire either, huh?

The price being super insanely high is one thing, but
anyone who does buy the place is going to be assumed
to be in cahoots with Velgalta!

No Orianan buyers either, eh... Now that you mention
it, relations between the two have been effectively
suspended since the war...

And as if the bad luck couldn't get any worse,
since around two years ago there's even been
some trouble with a ghost hitting the price tag.
A ghost...?!

Yes. Rumor says that it's haunted by the spirit of an
old Altenan lord, perhaps tormented by the loss of
their nation to Velgalta.

Perhaps aided by the fact that the property comes
with a lot of political baggage, word of the haunting
has spread among relevant parties in Grazheim, making
for quite the headache for the real estate guild.

Attempting to remedy the situation would end up
benefiting Velgalta, but this would anger Midgar...
and so the property continues to go untouched.

So, any misstep could also threaten Grazheim's
position as a trade city built on international
business dealings...

Diplomatic situation of the manor aside, it seems
there's a ghost situation that is more than meets
the eye. Any thoughts, Gamma?
It all seems like a hoax to me... I'm not convinced.

So let's say this lord really did come back as a
restless spirit. Shouldn't he be haunting a location
within the Altena Empire?
Totally! He's in the wrong spot!
Exactly! The causal relationship doesn't add up!

What if the empire and real estate guild are
spreading these rumors intentionally, hoping to lower
the property value gently and entice a buyer?

If that's the scheme they're running in the
background, then all of this would make a lot more
sense!

I sooo get what you're saying. This definitely feels
cooked up!
Yeah, it feels like they have to be up to something!

...Hey, hold on, Iota! Don't go roping me into your
nonsense!

Wha?! Oh, c'mon, Gammy! You're the one who said it
first!

Heehee, if we're all in agreement, then our course is
clear. Let's move on to something a little more
forceful, as is our style.

We'll wait until the dead of night and then have a
look at this manor house. Gamma, Iota, prepare for a
stealth mission!
Yes, ma'am!
